alert.note: Alert for Page; Shenandoah (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 1:26PM EST until December 11 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations will range from a coating to a slushy inch below 1,000 feet, with 1 to 4 inches above 1,000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Shenandoah and Page Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 6 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, mainly above 1,000 feet. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute with snow covered and slippery surfaces, especially for elevations above 1,000 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and blowing snow may cause visibility to be reduced below one-half mile at times, especially for elevations above 1,000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
